gaps: daemon.ts parseBody() has no timeout or size limit on request body reading — slowloris or unbounded payload can hang/OOM the process
daemon.ts orphan sweep setInterval (line 1142) is never cleared on daemon shutdown — interval keeps running until force kill
daemon.ts handleUpdateCheck() fetch to npm registry has no timeout — blocks entire request if registry is slow or unreachable
daemon.ts URL construction (line 1150) with new URL() can throw if req.headers.host is malformed — no try/catch
daemon.ts sealOrphanFile() and recoverHeartbeat() have unguarded JSON.parse on chain file lines — corrupted chain files crash the process
register-tools.ts getFramework() call in useai_end tool (line 668) is not wrapped in try/catch — unknown framework ID crashes entire end-session flow
register-tools.ts writeJson() calls for milestones/sessions have no retry or fallback — data is silently lost on file write failure
session-state.ts appendFileSync (line 319) has no error handling — disk-full or permissions errors throw with no finally block to prevent chainTipHash update on failure
setup.ts tool.detect() (line 172) has no error handling — if detect throws (permission error), entire setup crashes
mcp-map.ts writeMcpMapping() (line 31) has no error handling — if writeJson fails, MCP→UseAI session mapping is silently lost and daemon recovery breaks
dashboard/local-api.ts readBody() has no size limit on request body — unbounded data causes OOM
dashboard/local-api.ts performSync fetch, milestone publish fetch, and all auth fetches have no timeout — hang indefinitely if useai.dev API is down
dashboard/local-api.ts handleCloudPull pagination while-loop has no page limit — corrupted pagination headers cause infinite loop

violations: Pattern duplication: Tool registry in tools.ts reimplements installStandardHttp, installVscodeHttp, readTomlFile, writeTomlFile, installTomlHttp, readYamlFile, writeYamlFile, installYamlHttp, installCrushHttp — all duplicated in packages/cli/src/services/tools.ts

Large file: daemon.ts at 1442 lines handles HTTP server setup, session management, orphan recovery, stale session recovery, auto-seal logic, dashboard serving, health checks, MCP protocol server, and local API handlers — should be split into focused modules

Large file: dashboard/local-api.ts at 711 lines implements 19 HTTP handlers spanning data retrieval, configuration, sync operations, authentication, profile management, and data deletion — could be split into domain-specific handler modules
Large file: register-tools.ts at 963 lines embeds all MCP tool definitions and handlers inline within a single registerTools() function plus session enrichment logic — should be modularized
Dead code: getInstructionsText() and getInstructions() in tools.ts are exported but only consumed internally within tools.ts — never imported by any other file

gaps: daemon/ensure.ts findPidsByPort() interpolates port directly into execSync shell command without validation — potential shell injection on Windows netstat and macOS lsof commands
daemon/ensure.ts spawn() in ensureDaemon() (line 192) never registers an 'error' event handler — if npx doesn't exist, error event is unhandled and daemon start silently fails
daemon/ensure.ts killDaemon() has race condition between isProcessRunning() check and unlinkSync() on PID file — another instance could restart between check and delete
daemon/ensure.ts checkDaemonHealth() catches all errors uniformly — no distinction between timeout, connection refused, and DNS failure; no logging of actual error
daemon/resolve-npx.ts buildNodePath() filters directories via existsSync() but paths could be deleted before daemon starts — TOCTOU vulnerability
daemon/resolve-npx.ts resolveNpxPath() interpolates $SHELL env var directly into execSync without validation — malicious SHELL value enables command injection
daemon/autostart.ts installMacos() target variable not shell-quoted in execSync — paths with spaces or special chars break silently
daemon/autostart.ts installLinux() systemctl execSync at lines 146-147 have no try/catch — if systemctl fails, error is silently ignored and function returns success
daemon/check-update.ts fetchLatestVersion() does not validate npm registry JSON response — data.version not checked for valid semver format
crypto/keystore.ts decryptKeystore() decipher.final() can throw on GCM tag validation failure with no custom error message or context
crypto/derive.ts deriveEncryptionKey() calls os.userInfo() which can throw on some systems — no try/catch or fallback
crypto/verify.ts verifySignature() calls createPublicKey() without validating that PEM is actually an Ed25519 key — wrong key type accepted silently
utils/fs.ts readJson() catch block returns fallback without distinguishing between 'file not found' and 'corrupted JSON' — callers cannot tell if data file is damaged
utils/fs.ts writeJson() uses process PID in temp filename — concurrent writes in same process can collide; renameSync is not atomic on all filesystems
hooks/claude-code.ts writeFileSync for settings (line 71) overwrites without backup — partial write failure loses entire Claude Code settings with no rollback
hooks/claude-code.ts installClaudeCodeHooks() catches chmod errors silently (lines 87-88) — hook scripts may not execute but no verification or fallback
validation/schemas.ts date regex /^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}$/ matches invalid dates like '9999-99-99' — no semantic date validation
validation/guards.ts hasTimeOverlap() creates Date objects from strings without validating ISO format — Invalid Date comparison silently returns false instead of erroring
scoring/aps.ts computeLocalAPS() uses non-null assertions sorted[0]! and sorted[sorted.length-1]! — filter could produce empty array after original length check passes
utils/config-migrate.ts migrateConfig() uses 'as unknown as UseaiConfig' double-cast — corrupted config passes migration without any runtime validation
constants/paths.ts USEAI_HOME reads from env var without validating the path exists or is writable — empty string or non-existent directory silently accepted

violations: Dead code: exceedsMaxDailyHours(), exceedsMaxContinuous(), isSpikeFromAverage(), hasTimeOverlap() in validation/guards.ts are exported but never imported by any production code across the monorepo — only referenced in guards.test.ts
Dead code: computeLocalAPS() in scoring/aps.ts is exported via barrel but never imported by any production code across the monorepo
Dead code: verifyChainRecord(), verifySignature(), verifyChain() in crypto/verify.ts are exported via barrel but never imported by any production code — only referenced in verify.test.ts

gaps: commands/login.ts apiCall() fetch (line 8) has no timeout — hangs indefinitely on network failure with no AbortController
commands/login.ts res.json() (line 15) can throw on non-JSON response but is not wrapped in try/catch — malformed server response crashes login flow
commands/login.ts result.user.id/email/username (lines 93-107) accessed without null checks — partial user object from API causes crash
commands/serve.ts setInterval (line 35) never cleared if process exits via means other than SIGINT/SIGTERM
commands/daemon.ts spawn() child process (lines 40-48) has no 'error' event handler — if npx fails to execute, error event is unhandled
commands/daemon.ts health object fields (lines 116-129) cast without validation — unsafe 'as number'/'as string' on unvalidated daemon response
commands/update.ts no rollback mechanism if daemon fails to update — old daemon killed, tools removed, but new daemon may fail to start, leaving user in broken state
commands/update.ts tool.remove() errors in loop (lines 48-55) caught silently — user doesn't know how many tools failed to remove
commands/setup.ts checkbox() catch block (lines 203, 287) is empty — user interruption errors silently swallowed with no diagnostics
commands/config.ts updateConfig() calls (lines 21-51) not wrapped in try/catch — filesystem errors propagate unhandled to user
commands/purge.ts readline interface not closed on error path (line 12) — if question throws or EOF sent, rl never closes (resource leak)
commands/purge.ts rmSync with force:true (line 35) suppresses all errors — user told data deleted when it may not be
services/tools.ts readJsonFile() returns empty object for ALL errors (lines 78-84) — file permission errors treated same as missing file, masking real problems
services/tools.ts writeFileSync calls (lines 89, 200, 255) have no try/catch — if directory not writable, exception unhandled
services/tools.ts removeInstructions catch blocks (lines 400, 419) are empty — file deletion failures silently swallowed
utils/display.ts table() function Math.max(...rows.map()) with empty rows returns -Infinity — empty array causes formatting error
index.ts program.parse() (line 36) can throw on async command failures but no global error handler registered

violations: Pattern duplication: services/tools.ts (762 lines) reimplements the full AI-tool registry, config format handlers (JSON/TOML/YAML read/write), and HTTP install helpers that also exist in packages/mcp/src/tools.ts via @devness/mcp-setup

Large file: services/tools.ts at 762 lines combines type definitions, constants, file I/O utilities, 6 config format handler sets, HTTP install helpers, instruction injection logic, tool creation/resolution, 24+ hardcoded tool definitions, and re-injection logic
Naming inconsistency: services/tools.ts does not follow the *.service.ts naming convention used by services/config.service.ts and services/stats.service.ts in the same directory

gaps: No global NestJS ExceptionFilter configured — unhandled exceptions return raw error details including stack traces to clients
No request timeout middleware configured — long-running requests hang indefinitely with no protection
No rate limiting on any endpoint — auth endpoints (OTP send/verify) and API key endpoints accept unlimited requests
database/database.provider.ts creates postgres client with no pool configuration (max connections, idle timeout) and no onModuleDestroy hook to close connection on shutdown
database/migrate.ts client.end() only called on success path — if migrate() throws, database connection is orphaned
auth/auth.service.ts sendOtp() has no try/catch around bcrypt.hash() or database insert — exceptions bubble unhandled with no context
auth/auth.service.ts sendOtp() returns 'OTP sent' even if emailService.sendOtpEmail() fails — misleading success response when email never delivered
auth/auth.service.ts verifyOtp() has race condition — concurrent requests can use same OTP, and between user lookup and insert duplicate users can be created
email/email.service.ts send() fetch to Resend API has no timeout or retry logic — network failure means email permanently lost with no recovery
email/email.service.ts constructor logs warning if RESEND_API_KEY missing but service still created — all subsequent send() calls fail silently
admin/admin.guard.ts uses strict equality (===) for token comparison — timing attack vulnerability; should use crypto.timingSafeEqual()
admin/admin.guard.ts no logging on failed auth attempts — cannot detect brute force attacks
admin/admin.service.ts getDashboard() catch block returns hardcoded zeros on ANY error — masks which query failed, no logging, clients see zeros instead of error state
admin/admin.service.ts all list methods (getUsers, getSessions, getMilestones, getSyncs, getAlerts) catch all errors and return empty arrays — no distinction between 'no data' and 'query failed'
keys/keys.service.ts registerPublicKey() deletes old keys before inserting new one — if insert fails, old key is permanently lost with no transaction rollback
keys/keys.service.ts validates key with string.includes('PUBLIC KEY') only — accepts malformed PEM that will fail on actual crypto operations
sync/sync.service.ts processSync() checks existence then updates/inserts — race condition between check and write allows duplicate records
sync/sync.service.ts updateStreak() reads existing streak, calculates new one, then writes — concurrent requests can overwrite each other's streak data
leaderboard/leaderboard.service.ts recomputeLeaderboard() deletes all records then inserts new ones without transaction — partial insert failure loses all leaderboard data
leaderboard/leaderboard.service.ts no distributed lock on cron execution — multiple server instances run recompute simultaneously causing data corruption
milestones/milestones.service.ts publish() uses unsafe cast 'milestones as MilestoneInput[]' and no transaction — partial insert failure leaves inconsistent state
profiles/profiles.service.ts getPublicProfile() fetches all user syncs then filters in memory — user with many syncs causes memory pressure
common/guards/api-token-auth.guard.ts queries database on every single request for key validation — no caching, causes heavy database load
All controllers use parseInt() for query params without NaN validation or max bounds checking — negative/NaN/excessive values passed to database queries
sync/sync.controller.ts casts body to Record<string, unknown> with no schema validation before passing to service

violations: Dead code: ZodValidationPipe in common/pipes/zod-validation.pipe.ts is defined with tests but is never applied to any controller route via @UsePipes() or registered globally in AppModule
Inconsistent validation: auth.controller.ts uses manual if-checks (if (!body.email) throw BadRequestException) in sendOtp and verifyOtp routes instead of the project-defined ZodValidationPipe pattern

Incomplete implementation: ProfilesService.getPublicProfile() returns hardcoded empty arrays for top_tools and top_languages despite dailySyncs table containing clients and languages data that could be aggregated

gaps: lib/api.ts get()/post()/patch()/del() have no timeout on fetch calls — network hangs block UI indefinitely with no AbortController
lib/api.ts post() and patch() silently swallow JSON parse errors with .catch(() => ({})) — error context lost, returns empty object as if success
lib/api.ts del() uses 'error' field for error extraction instead of 'message' like other functions — inconsistent, could produce undefined error messages
lib/api.ts postSync() uses Promise.all for fetchSessions/fetchMilestones — single failure stops entire sync with no partial recovery
lib/api.ts postSync() sync loop has no retry mechanism — if 5th batch of 10 fails, first 4 already synced with no rollback or tracking
lib/api.ts postVerifyOtp() sets multiple localStorage items without try/catch — QuotaExceededError leaves partial auth state
store.ts loadAll() catch block sets loading:false but provides no error state — user sees stale data with no indication that refresh failed
store.ts loadHealth() and loadUpdateCheck() have 'catch { /* ignore */ }' blocks — health check failures invisible to UI
store.ts deleteSession()/deleteConversation()/deleteMilestone() use optimistic updates that revert on error without user notification — item disappears then reappears with no explanation
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx debounceRef timeout not cleared on component unmount — fires setState on unmounted component
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx abortRef AbortController created but signal never passed to fetch — dead code, requests are never actually cancelled
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx click-outside and escape-key listeners added on each render when open=true — rapid open/close accumulates duplicate event listeners
components/SettingsPage.tsx structuredClone(c) called without null check on config — null config crashes component
components/SettingsPage.tsx error toast auto-clears after 3s via setTimeout — not cancelled on unmount, triggers setState warning
components/EvaluationStatsBar.tsx requestAnimationFrame-based animation never cancelled on unmount — memory leak and wasted CPU
No runtime schema validation on any API response — TypeScript interfaces don't protect against malformed data at runtime

violations: Type duplication: lib/api.ts locally defines SessionSeal, Milestone, SessionEvaluation, and LocalConfig interfaces instead of importing from @useai/shared — the local LocalConfig has a flat structure incompatible with the nested CaptureConfig/SyncConfig structure in @useai/shared
Missing dependency: @useai/shared is not declared in package.json dependencies, preventing import of shared types and forcing local type duplication

No custom hooks extracted: auth flow (send OTP, verify OTP, sync, logout), API fetching with loading/error state, and config update patterns are repeated inline across ProfileDropdown.tsx and SettingsPage.tsx instead of being abstracted into reusable hooks

gaps: lib/api-client.ts clientFetch throws Error with only status code — response body context lost, making debugging impossible
lib/api-client.ts res.json() has no error handling for malformed JSON responses — unhandled exception on non-JSON server response
lib/api-client.ts no timeout configured on any fetch call — all network operations can hang indefinitely
lib/auth.ts localStorage.getItem/removeItem not wrapped in try/catch — throws if localStorage disabled or quota exceeded
hooks/usePresence.ts catch blocks are empty — all errors including non-network issues silently swallowed with no logging
hooks/usePresence.ts no timeout on apiFetch calls — component hangs on network failure
store/dashboard-store.ts Promise.all catch swallows error without distinguishing which API failed — stale data shown with no error indicator
store/dashboard-store.ts localStorage.getItem not in try/catch — hydration crashes if storage disabled
store/auth-store.ts JSON.parse in try/catch silently ignores parse errors — corrupted user data quietly set to null with no logging
store/auth-store.ts localStorage.setItem can throw QuotaExceededError — not caught, auth state partially saved
app/login/page.tsx catch blocks treat all errors identically — network errors, JSON parse errors, rate limits all show same generic message
app/login/page.tsx data.user accessed without null check — partial API response crashes login flow
app/dashboard/layout.tsx apiFetch for user has no try/catch — network error during dashboard load silently fails without logout or error state
app/dashboard/layout.tsx 100ms setTimeout for auth check is a race condition — hydrate() may not have updated token yet
app/dashboard/settings/page.tsx setTimeout for error clear not cancelled on unmount — potential setState on unmounted component
app/(public)/[username]/page.tsx server-side fetch has no timeout — slow API blocks page generation indefinitely
app/(public)/leaderboard/page.tsx no AbortController for fetch deduplication — multiple concurrent fetchLeaderboard calls on rapid remount
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx username check debounce timer not cleared on unmount — API response tries setState on unmounted component
components/ProfileDropdown.tsx rapid input creates out-of-order API responses — no request cancellation, stale 'available'/'taken' status displayed
components/TopNav.tsx GitHub API fetch .then(r => r.ok ? r.json() : null) — if r.json() rejects, unhandled promise rejection
components/HeroHeading.tsx chained setTimeout animations have no cleanup — component unmount during animation fires setState on unmounted component
components/RadarChart.tsx data[d.key] / 100 has no null check — undefined data key produces NaN in SVG rendering

violations: Dead code: check-err.js references port 3457 but dev server runs on port 3456 (per package.json 'next dev --port 3456') — stale development artifact not referenced anywhere

Large file: Landing page src/app/(public)/page.tsx at 930 lines defines multiple inline component patterns, data constants (AI_TOOLS, FEATURES, STEPS, RADAR_DIMENSIONS, DASHBOARD_SECTIONS), and animation variants that should be extracted into separate files

Pattern inconsistency: Policy pages (about/page.tsx 367 lines, privacy/page.tsx 473 lines, security/page.tsx 285 lines, terms/page.tsx 321 lines) share nearly identical page header, section divider, and hud-border card structure but don't use a shared template/layout component — ~1,446 lines of duplicated structure

gaps: stats.ts computeStats() accesses s.duration_seconds, s.files_touched, s.client, s.languages, s.task_type without null/undefined checks — undefined properties produce NaN or silent data corruption
stats.ts calculateStreak() uses sorted[i-1]! and sorted[i]! non-null assertions without full bounds validation after filter operations
stats.ts parseTimestamp() returns NaN for malformed ISO strings — callers use result in comparisons without NaN check, silently producing wrong date filtering
stats.ts s.evaluation! non-null assertion used after filter but TypeScript doesn't enforce runtime safety — changed evaluation structure crashes silently
stats.ts filterSessionsByWindow() creates Date objects from strings without validating ISO format — Invalid Date comparisons silently return false
components/StatsBar.tsx animateCounter() requestAnimationFrame callback doesn't check if DOM element still exists — throws if element removed during animation
components/SessionList.tsx IntersectionObserver created but sentinelRef.current not null-checked before observer.observe()
components/SearchOverlay.tsx escape key handler captures onClose in closure — if onClose prop changes between renders, stale callback is invoked
components/SearchOverlay.tsx and TimeDetailPanel.tsx both set document.body.style.overflow='hidden' independently — closing one modal re-enables scroll when other modal still open
components/TimeDetailPanel.tsx computeActivePeriods() silently skips sessions where end <= start with no logging — data quality issues hidden from user
components/DailyRecap.tsx getSessionsInRange() creates Date from s.started_at without validation — invalid ISO string parsed as current time, silently corrupting metrics
components/ProjectAllocation.tsx share = sliceMs / numProjects — numProjects derived from filtered keys could be 0 despite outer guard, producing Infinity
components/DashboardBody.tsx readLocalStorage() and writeLocalStorage() have empty catch blocks — localStorage failures completely invisible for debugging
components/RecentMilestones.tsx relativeTime() calls new Date(iso).getTime() without validating ISO string — NaN diff produces wrong relative time display
stats.ts Record<string, number> accumulation for byClient/byLanguage/byTaskType doesn't guard against prototype pollution — keys like '__proto__' from untrusted data could pollute object prototype

violations: Large file: TimeScrubber.tsx at 533 lines and TimeDetailPanel.tsx at 508 lines contain multiple internal helper components (SessionTooltip, MilestoneTooltip in TimeScrubber; ExplanationBlock, CalcRow, ActiveTimeContent, AITimeContent, ParallelContent, StreakContent, SessionList in TimeDetailPanel) that could be extracted into separate files
Unused dependency: clsx is declared in package.json but has zero imports across all source files in packages/ui/src — all conditional styling uses template literals instead

Code duplication: formatDuration() is independently defined in TimeScrubber.tsx, TimeDetailPanel.tsx, SessionList.tsx, and SessionCard.tsx with slight variations (TimeDetailPanel uses different rounding logic) — should be extracted to a shared utility

gaps: lib/api-client.ts fetch() not wrapped in try/catch — network failure throws unhandled rejection with no context
lib/api-client.ts no timeout mechanism on any fetch request — hanging server response blocks UI indefinitely
lib/api-client.ts res.json() error path returns empty object via .catch(() => ({})) — error context silently lost
lib/api-client.ts VITE_API_URL not validated — undefined or malformed env var causes all requests to fail with no helpful error message
lib/use-api.ts no AbortController to cancel in-flight requests on component unmount — setState called on unmounted component causes memory leak
lib/use-api.ts promise chain collapses all error types (network, parse, auth, server) into single err.message — if error is not Error instance, message is undefined
lib/use-api.ts no retry mechanism — single network failure is permanent until user manually navigates away and back
lib/auth.ts parseToken() catch block returns null for ALL errors with no logging — cannot distinguish invalid JWT format from malformed base64 from null payload
store/admin-store.ts localStorage.setItem() and removeItem() can throw QuotaExceededError — not wrapped in try/catch
store/admin-store.ts reads admin_token from localStorage on init without validating it's a valid JWT — corrupted token accepted silently
pages/dashboard/index.tsx API failure returns hardcoded zero values object — user cannot distinguish 'system has zero activity' from 'failed to load data'
pages/users/index.tsx calls .toLowerCase() on u.username and u.email without null checks — null values from API crash filter function
pages/system/index.tsx health.status === 'ok' uses case-sensitive comparison — API returning 'OK' or 'Ok' incorrectly shown as unhealthy
pages/analytics/languages.tsx Object.entries(breakdown) iterated without validating values are numbers — mixed types from API cause incorrect sorting
pages/analytics/index.tsx totalSeconds reduce can produce NaN if d.totalSeconds is null/undefined — NaN propagates through division producing incorrect dashboard values
pages/milestones/flagged.tsx action buttons (approve/reject/unpublish) have no onClick handlers — buttons appear functional but do nothing
pages/leaderboard/index.tsx 'Recompute Rankings' button has no onClick handler — non-functional admin action
components/shared/data-table.tsx sort function coerces values to empty string with ?? '' — mixed number/string columns sort lexicographically ('10' < '2')
main.tsx has no React ErrorBoundary — any component error crashes entire admin app with no recovery UI

violations: Dead code: Zustand store in admin-store.ts defines sidebarOpen, filters state and toggleSidebar, setFilter, clearFilters actions that are never called anywhere in the application
Dead code: Search input in topbar.tsx has no onChange handler or state binding — purely decorative
Dead code: Recompute Rankings button in leaderboard/index.tsx has no onClick handler
Dead code: Three action buttons (Approve, Edit, Unpublish) in milestones/flagged.tsx have no onClick handlers
Unused dependency: @useai/shared is declared in package.json but never imported in any source file — misses shared VERSION, types, and constants
Placeholder pages: users/[id].tsx, analytics/growth.tsx, analytics/tools.tsx are stubs with no implementation — only render placeholder messages
Pattern inconsistency: Uses unicode symbols (◉, ◎, ▣, ◆, ⟳, ▲, ◧, ▽, ⚙) for navigation icons instead of lucide-react icons used by dashboard and web packages
Pattern inconsistency: Hardcodes version string 'v0.2.0' in sidebar.tsx line 46 instead of importing VERSION from @useai/shared — shared VERSION is currently '0.7.0'
Incomplete implementation: Recent Activity section in dashboard/index.tsx renders hardcoded 'No recent activity' with no data integration

gaps: main.ts bootstrap() has no try/catch — if NestFactory.createApplicationContext() fails, application crashes without any error logging
main.ts signal handlers (lines 11-15) call app.close() without error handling — if close() throws, process may not exit cleanly and resources leak
main.ts bootstrap() call on line 18 has no .catch() — unhandled promise rejection if bootstrap fails
worker.module.ts REDIS_PORT defaults to 6479 instead of standard 6379 — likely typo that silently fails to connect to Redis at runtime
worker.module.ts useFactory callback has no try/catch — if config.get() throws, error propagates unhandled during module initialization
worker.module.ts no validation that REDIS_HOST and REDIS_PORT are valid formats before passing to BullModule connection
card/card.service.ts generateCard() has no try/catch — satori() and sharp() failures crash the job processor with no error logging or context
card/card.service.ts fonts array is hardcoded empty — satori rendering without fonts may produce invisible or broken text with no warning
card/card.service.ts no null/undefined validation on data parameter — null data passed to ShareCard causes runtime error
card/card.processor.ts process() method has no try/catch — job processing errors are unhandled by the processor itself
card/card.processor.ts no timeout on card generation — if satori/sharp hang, job hangs indefinitely
card/card.processor.ts no validation of job.data structure before passing to service — invalid data structure silently accepted
card/card.processor.ts TODO comment indicates storage upload is unimplemented — generated cards written to /tmp but never uploaded, with no warning to callers
storage/storage.service.ts upload() has no try/catch — fs.mkdir() and fs.writeFile() failures for permission denied or disk full are unhandled
storage/storage.service.ts key parameter not sanitized — path traversal via '../' in key allows writing files outside intended directory (security vulnerability)
storage/storage.service.ts S3 upload is unimplemented but returns hardcoded success URL — silent failure masquerading as success; callers believe upload succeeded
storage/storage.service.ts fallback to /tmp for missing S3_BUCKET — temporary storage gets cleaned up by OS, cards permanently lost with no warning
storage/storage.service.ts no retry logic — single filesystem failure causes permanent job failure with no recovery
card/templates/share-card.tsx formatNumber() has no guard for NaN, null, or undefined input — produces 'NaN' or throws in template rendering

violations: Configuration inconsistency: Default Redis port is 6479 in worker.module.ts line 16 vs standard 6379 in packages/api/src/queue/queue.module.ts — likely a typo causing connection failures when REDIS_PORT env var is not set

Mixed test frameworks: Uses both Jest (card.test.ts, storage.service.test.ts, card.service.test.ts) and Vitest (card.processor.test.ts, share-card.test.tsx) in the same package — other packages use one framework consistently
Dead code: StorageService is defined and exported in storage.module.ts but never injected into CardProcessor which writes to hardcoded /tmp/card-{userId}.png path instead
Dead code: contentType parameter in StorageService.upload() is declared but never referenced in the method body
Pattern inconsistency: main.ts uses console.log for startup logging instead of NestJS Logger used by services in this package and in packages/api
Pattern inconsistency: worker.module.ts and card.processor.ts hardcode string 'render-queue' instead of importing RENDER_QUEUE constant defined in packages/api/src/queue/queue.constants.ts

Incomplete implementation: Satori fonts array is empty (fonts:[]) in card.service.ts so card text rendering uses fallback; S3/R2 upload in storage.service.ts is a TODO stub that logs a warning and returns a mock URL
Missing test infrastructure: Neither jest nor vitest is declared in devDependencies despite 5 test files using both frameworks, and no test script is defined in package.json
Unused dependency: @useai/shared is declared in package.json dependencies but never imported in any source file under src/

journeys.name: MCP session lifecycle (start → heartbeat → end → seal)
steps: AI tool calls useai_start with task metadata
Session state initialized with chain record
Periodic useai_heartbeat calls update activity timestamp
AI tool calls useai_end with evaluation and milestones
Session sealed with Ed25519 signature and moved to sealed directory

journeys.name: User authentication and cloud sync
steps: User requests OTP via POST /api/auth/send-otp
User verifies OTP via POST /api/auth/verify-otp and receives JWT
Client syncs local sessions via POST /api/sync with JWT
Server validates sync payload and persists to database

journeys.name: Dashboard session browsing and filtering
steps: Dashboard loads sessions from daemon local API
User views stats bar with evaluation metrics
User filters sessions by date range via time scrubber
User searches sessions by keyword
User views session details and milestones

journeys.name: MCP tool setup and installation
steps: Detect installed AI tools on the system
User selects tools to configure
Install MCP config entries (HTTP or stdio)
Inject UseAI instructions into tool rules files
Start daemon process for HTTP transport

journeys.name: Public profile and leaderboard viewing
steps: User registers and syncs sessions to cloud
Other users view public profile via GET /api/profile/:username
Leaderboard aggregates and ranks users via GET /api/leaderboard
Share card rendered via POST /api/render/card

journeys.name: Dashboard real daemon data validation
steps: Daemon starts with seeded session and milestone data
Dashboard loads and displays seeded sessions
User applies client and project filters
Stats integrity verified against seed expectations
User deletes sessions and verifies cleanup

contracts.requestSchema: { username?: string, display_name?: string, avatar_url?: string, bio?: string }
